title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1262.39 - Use of fuel and lubricant facilities restricted
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1262.39 - Use of fuel and lubricant facilities restricted

State Regulations
(a) Unless otherwise provided in a lease or
other agreement, all operators of aircraft using Kennedy International Airport
who receive, and all persons who supply, aviation fuel and lubricating oil at
said air terminal, shall use the aviation fuel storage and delivery facilities, constructed by the Port Authority on the south side of Bergen Basin, or such
other facilities as may be designated by the Port Authority for such
use. (b) If and for any period
during which said facilities are not available, said operators may make other
arrangements with their suppliers of aviation fuel for deliveries thereof to
their aircraft, provided that such other arrangement shall be subject to the
approval of the Port Authority from the standpoint of safety, traffic control
and similar matters. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
1262.39

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
